forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Partly cloudy, with a low around 46. West northwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The air, brisk and expectant, carries whispers of a shifting sky over Downtown San Francisco this afternoon. A fleeting shimmer of sunlight breaks through, teasing the landscape, yet the forecast hints at shyer clouds to come. Temperatures hover in the low fifties, a gentle reminder that the chill of evening approaches. Although the sun may jar you awake with its brief visibility, a soft west wind stays constant, murmuring tales of the bay and hinting at the possibility of rain. 

As dusk encroaches, a possibility of developing showers emerges, cloaked in the promise of a gray blanket overhead. Dress accordingly—layers, perhaps a cozy jacket to fend off the evening’s bite, and maybe an umbrella tucked beneath your arm for those unpredictable drops. A stroll through a nearby park could invigorate your senses, and perhaps a stop at a local café can warm your spirit as you watch the clouds swirl above, planning their ephemeral dance with the city.  It’s a day that speaks of gentle adventures and quiet moments, as the ambiance shifts with the promise of rain, inviting contemplation in this ever-spirited city.
